column11:
This table presents a semester summary of Student Credit Hours (SCH) and Full-Time Equivalent (FTE) enrollment for five groups (most likely schools within CCSU).

What the columns mean:

Undergrad / Graduate Credit Hours – credit hours taught at each level.

Total Credit Hours – sum of undergrad and graduate credit hours.

Graduate Extra Credit – additional weight given to graduate-level instruction.

Grand Total Credit Hours – overall credit load after adding extra graduate credits.

FTE Undergrad / Graduate / Total – standardized enrollment counts (UG SCH ÷ 15, GR SCH ÷ 12).

Highlights from the data shown:

The largest contributor generated 58,589 credit hours and 3,764 FTEs, reflecting the highest instructional load.

The next two groups produced 17,773 (1,066 FTEs) and 17,514 (705 FTEs) respectively, both with substantial graduate credit contributions.

Another large group accounted for 43,211 credit hours, equating to 2,655 FTEs.

A small “No School” or miscellaneous category contributed 299 credit hours and just 18 FTEs.
